intro: Vavaea ardisioides, commonly known as the silverleaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
